name: Cowardice
text: Whenever a creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, return that creature to its owner's hand. (It won't be affected by the spell or ability.)

editions.flavor: Gerrard was the Mercadian soldiers' greatest hero; they followed him blindly. When he left, they stumbled around blindly.

name: Cowed by Wisdom
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block unless its controller pays {1} for each card in your hand.

name: Cower in Fear
text: Creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"You will fully understand fear when you discover it is the final thing you put your faith in."
—Nicol Bolas

"You will fully understand fear when you discover it is the final thing you put your faith in."
—Nicol Bolas
Consulate guards who pursue fleeing renegades into the Cowl often become lost—occasionally permanently—in the city's wildest greenbelt.

name: Crabapple Cohort
text: Crabapple Cohort gets +1/+1 as long as you control another green creature.

editions.flavor: Seven wives made seven pies from seven apples, each plucked from its branches. Now bare and bitter, it comes to exact its price: one apple, one bone.

name: Crab Umbra
text:
Enchant creature
{2}{U}: Untap enchanted creature.
Totem armor (If enchanted creature would be destroyed, instead remove all damage from it and destroy this Aura.)

name: Crackdown
text: Nonwhite creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

editions.flavor:
"There is no place for mercy in defense of our lives."
—Ta-Spon, Cho-Arrim executioner

name: Crackdown Construct
text: Whenever you activate an ability of an artifact or creature that isn't a mana ability, Crackdown Construct gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"All buildings are subject to search. Resistance will be punished."
—Enforcer-Chief Ranaj

name: Crackleburr
text:
{U/R}{U/R}, {T}, Tap two untapped red creatures you control: Crackleburr deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
{U/R}{U/R}, {Q}, Untap two tapped blue creatures you control: Return target creature to its owner's hand. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)

name: Crackling Club
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0.
Sacrifice Crackling Club: Crackling Club deals 1 damage to target creature.

editions.flavor: It adds injury to injury.

name: Crackling Doom
text: Crackling Doom deals 2 damage to each opponent. Each opponent sacrifices a creature with the greatest power among creatures he or she controls.

editions.flavor: Do not fear the lightning. Fear the one it obeys.
Do not fear the lightning. Fear the one it obeys.
Do not fear the lightning. Fear the one it obeys.

name: Crackling Perimeter
text: Tap an untapped Gate you control: Crackling Perimeter deals 1 damage to each opponent.

editions.flavor: As the path he sought came into focus, Niv-Mizzet took steps to prevent others from approaching it.

name: Crackling Triton
text: {2}{R}, Sacrifice Crackling Triton: Crackling Triton deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: He calls upon both the currents in the sea and the current in the clouds.

name: Crack the Earth
text: Each player sacrifices a permanent.

editions.flavor:
"As the war progressed, the destruction the kami caused became more widespread and less predictable."
—Observations of the Kami War

name: Cradle Guard
text:
Trample
Echo {1}{G}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

editions.flavor:
Mother, sleep / Dream our lives
Our roots your soul / Our leaves your bed.

name: Cradle of the Accursed
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Cradle of the Accursed: Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor: Many such monuments dot the wasteland known as Ifnir.

name: Cradle of Vitality
text: Whenever you gain life, you may pay {1}{W}. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature for each 1 life you gained.

editions.flavor: Naya's trees grow tall and sturdy. Their foliage intertwines to form dewcups, rainwater pools where the elves gather to celebrate life.
Naya's trees grow tall and sturdy. Their foliage intertwines to form dewcups, rainwater pools where the elves gather to celebrate life.

name: Cradle to Grave
text: Destroy target nonblack creature that entered the battlefield this turn.

editions.flavor:
"As the fell soil's appetite grows, it gulps down passersby upon their first footfall."
—Ezrith, druid of the Dark Hours

name: Crafty Pathmage
text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

editions.flavor:
Follow the pathmage
—Otarian expression meaning
"escape quickly"

Follow the pathmage
—Otarian expression meaning
"escape quickly"
The most valuable commodity in the pits is a way out.

name: Cragganwick Cremator
text: When Cragganwick Cremator enters the battlefield, discard a card at random. If you discard a creature card this way, Cragganwick Cremator deals damage equal to that card's power to target player.

editions.flavor: Each night that his bowl fills, a village mourns.

name: Crag Puca
text: {U/R}: Switch Crag Puca's power and toughness until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Be happy when you see a puca shaped like mischief. It's far better than one shaped like death."
—Dindun of Kulrath Mine

name: Crag Saurian
text: Whenever a source deals damage to Crag Saurian, that source's controller gains control of Crag Saurian.

editions.flavor: It follows the strongest leader—the one with the longest whip.

name: Cranial Archive
text: {2}, Exile Cranial Archive: Target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library. Draw a card.

editions.flavor: The greatest idea the zombie ever had in its head wasn't even its own.

name: Cranial Extraction
text: Name a nonland card. Search target player's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with that name and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Cranial Plating
Crash
text:
You may sacrifice a Mountain rather than pay Crash's mana cost.
Destroy target artifact.

editions.flavor: Gerrard shook his head as the ground rushed to meet him. "This," he thought, "is not the start I was hoping for."

name: Crashing Boars
text: Whenever Crashing Boars attacks, defending player chooses an untapped creature he or she controls. That creature blocks Crashing Boars this turn if able.

editions.flavor: Bores ruin a party. Boars are party to ruin.
Bores ruin a party. Boars are party to ruin.
Bores ruin a party. Boars are party to ruin.

name: Crashing Centaur
text:
{G}, Discard a card: Crashing Centaur gains trample until end of turn.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Crashing Centaur gets +2/+2 and has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

name: Crash Landing
text: Target creature with flying loses flying until end of turn. Crash Landing deals damage to that creature equal to the number of Forests you control.

editions.flavor:
"The other guilds think they're untouchable. It's time we brought them back down to earth."
—Ghut Rak, Gruul guildmage

name: Crash of Rhinos
text: Trample

editions.flavor:
Love is like a rhino, short-sighted and hasty; if it cannot find a way, it will make a way.
—Femeref adage

Love is like a rhino, short-sighted and hasty; if it cannot find a way, it will make a way.
—Femeref adage

{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Crater Elemental: Crater Elemental deals 4 damage to target creature.

text:
Echo {4}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Crater Hellion enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to each other creature.

text:
Haste
When Craterhoof Behemoth enters the battlefield, creatures you control gain trample and get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creatures you control.

editions.flavor: Its footsteps of today are the lakes of tomorrow.

name: Craterize
text: Destroy target land.

editions.flavor:

—Chandra Nalaar

text:
Crater's Claws deals X damage to target creature or player.

text: Craven Giant can't block.

Whenever one or more land cards are put into your graveyard from anywhere for the first time each turn, create a 1/1 green Insect creature token.

name: Crawlspace
text: No more than two creatures can attack you each combat.

editions.flavor: The goblins did not understand their attraction to the mana rig. They simply knew it was where they belonged.
Lord Rondor arrived for battle with sixty war elephants, ten catapults, and two hundred of his finest archers. Then he saw the battlefield . . .

The most terrifying thing about the craw wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

name: Crazed Armodon
text: {G}: Crazed Armodon gets +3/+0 and gains trample until end of turn. Destroy Crazed Armodon at the beginning of the next end step. Activate this ability only once each turn.

editions.flavor: These are its last days. Mourning is over. Rage remains.

name: Crazed Firecat
text: When Crazed Firecat enters the battlefield, flip a coin until you lose a flip. Put a +1/+1 counter on Crazed Firecat for each flip you win.

editions.flavor:
"The longer it's caged, the madder it gets."
—Firecat handler

name: Crazed Goblin
text: Crazed Goblin attacks each turn if able.

editions.flavor: Because fighting is easier than figuring out what else to do.

name: Crazed Skirge
text: Flying, haste

They are Phyrexia's couriers; the messages they carry are inscribed on their slick hides.

name: Creakwood Ghoul
text: {B/G}{B/G}: Exile target card from a graveyard. You gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: Some eat the living. Some eat the dead. It eats the past.

text:
Other black creatures you control get +1/+1.

name: Cream of the Crop
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may look at the top X cards of your library, where X is that creature's power. If you do, put one of those cards on top of your library and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Creature Bond
text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, Creature Bond deals damage equal to that creature's toughness to the creature's controller.

name: Creature Guy
text: Gotcha Whenever an opponent says "Creature" or "Guy," you may say "Gotcha" If you do, return Creature Guy from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: There once was a player named Quinn, . . .

text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Credit Voucher: Shuffle any number of cards from your hand into your library, then draw that many cards.

text:
Trample
{1}{G}: Until end of turn, target creature you control has base power and toughness 5/5 and gains trample.

"I saw the devastation when the juggernauts crashed the walls of An Karras. Then I got to thinking."
—Janji, sylvan druid

name: Creeping Corrosion
text: Destroy all artifacts.

editions.flavor:
"We will reveal the futility of their heresy by showing them how fragile their relics are."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

name: Creeping Dread
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, each player discards a card. Each opponent who discarded a card that shares a card type with the card you discarded loses 3 life. (Players reveal the discarded cards simultaneously.)

name: Creeping Mold
text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.

editions.flavor:
"Mold could catch you."
—Suq'Ata insult

"Mold could catch you."
—Suq'Ata insult
Mold crept over the walls and into every crevice until the gleaming white stone strained and burst.
Sanctions, mandates, regulations . . . These things mean nothing to the natural world.

text:
Choose a permanent type. Return all cards of the chosen type from your graveyard to your hand.
Flashback {5}{G}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

text:
Creeping Tar Pit enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.
{1}{U}{B}: Creeping Tar Pit becomes a 3/2 blue and black Elemental creature until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn. It's still a land.

name: Creepy Doll
text:
Indestructible
Whenever Creepy Doll deals combat damage to a creature, flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy that creature.

editions.flavor: A child's porcelain doll went missing one night, as did a pair of kitchen shears and the town magistrate.

name: Cremate
text:
Exile target card from a graveyard.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Without a body, the soul is helpless to fight the terms of our contracts."
—Somhaur, Orzhov pontiff
Death's embrace need not be cold.
Cremation of the dead is not a religious ritual in Ravnica. It's a business designed to keep the Golgari from growing in numbers.

name: Crenellated Wall
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{T}: Target creature gets +0/+4 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Mercadian soldiers excel at finding things to stand behind.

editions.flavor:

name: Crimson Mage
text: {R}: Target creature you control gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

editions.flavor:
"We wield the fires of rage. War is our blood and destruction our birthright."
—Crimson creed

name: Crimson Manticore
text:
Flying
{R}, {T}: Crimson Manticore deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

editions.flavor: Noted neither for their good looks nor their charm, Crimson Manticores can be fearsome allies. As dinner companions, however, they are best left alone.

text:

text:

name: Crosis's Attendant

text:

• Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

text:
Flying
Whenever Crosis, the Purger deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{B}. If you do, choose a color, then that player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards of that color.

name: Crossbow Ambush
text: Creatures you control gain reach until end of turn. (They can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor:
There is no drake that flies faster than a crossbow bolt.
—Vec saying

name: Crossbow Infantry
text: {T}: Crossbow Infantry deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

editions.flavor:
"He can split a marshfly in two from halfway across the range."
—Onean sergeant
Twang. You're dead.

"He can split a marshfly in two from halfway across the range."
—Onean sergeant
The crossbow is the ideal weapon for the lazy Mercadians: just point and shoot.

name: Crossroads Consecrator
text: {G}, {T}: Target attacking Human gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "May the steel of your blade match the steel in your soul."

name: Crosstown Courier
text: Whenever Crosstown Courier deals combat damage to a player, that player puts that many cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: Information travels quickly through Ravnica's network of messengers and thought agents.
Information travels quickly through Ravnica's network of messengers and thought agents.

name: Crossway Vampire
text: When Crossway Vampire enters the battlefield, target creature can't block this turn.

editions.flavor: "Do not flatter Fate. It did not guide you into my clutches tonight. That was all my doing."

name: Crosswinds
text: Creatures with flying get -2/-0.

editions.flavor: Harbin's ornithopter had been trapped for two days within the currents of the storm. When the skies cleared, all he could see was a horizon of trees.

name: Crovax
text: Whenever a creature you control deals damage to a creature or player, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: How does one escape a curse? For Crovax, a wealthy noble, the answer may lie in joining the crew of the Weatherlight as they seek to rescue their abducted captain Sisay.  Secretly, he hopes in his journeys to find Selenia, the angelic being who abandoned him and his family years ago.

name: Crovax, Ascendant Hero
text:
Other white creatures get +1/+1.
Nonwhite creatures get -1/-1.
Pay 2 life: Return Crovax, Ascendant Hero to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Crovax was destined for an angel's curse, but one warped timeline saw the noble redeemed.

name: Crovax the Cursed
text:
Crovax the Cursed enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice a creature. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Crovax. If you don't, remove a +1/+1 counter from Crovax.
{B}: Crovax gains flying until end of turn.

name: Crowd Favorites
text:
{3}{W}: Tap target creature.
{3}{W}: Crowd Favorites gets +0/+5 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"The rabble likes them. Make sure they win, then book them for tomorrow."
—Cabal Patriarch
